formattedAddress: 130 Dyckman St, New York, NY 10040, USA
adrFormatAddress: 130 Dyckman St, New York, NY 10040, USA

originalText.text: This 5 stars is solely the responsibility of Lucia at this pharmacy. I don’t have health insurance so I use GoodRx, my rx was coming out way more expensive than what my GoodRx said, and the guy that was helping me didn’t want to do his job today so Lucia saw what was happening, stepped in and redid it, bringing it down to under 1/3 the price. Moral of the story - Lucia is awesome and deserves a raise. Cherish her.

originalText.text: The worse service I have ever had!! These people don’t know anything about customer service… I went to pick up my medication around 7:45pm. The pharmacy is supposed to close at 8:00pm, they didn’t even wait until 8:00pm to say that the are not taking more clients. There were a whole line waiting for them to move with the people but they just close the gate and didn’t care. If you don’t have love for a job, don’t take it!!!!

text.text: The worse service I have ever had!! These people don’t know anything about customer service… I went to pick up my medication around 7:45pm. originalText.text: I've worked many long hours in customer service so I know how it is on the other side of the counter. Today was over the top, I entered the store to pick up my medication which had taken several days to produce. The pharmacy closes at 8pm and I was on the line about 5 mins before 8. When I approached the counter the man with the reading glasses said " oh well come back tomorrow" without asking if the medication was dire or suggesting alternate ways of receiving the medication. I have been coming here for decades y'all. Not only that but the ENTIRE PHARMACY STAFF said  and I quote "oh well we dont care and if it were dire you would have picked it up already." They never asked me who the medication was for they said they wanted to go home. No job in this world is forever and you are not immune to firing. I spoke to the manager. This is no longer about the treatment of  customers.This incident goes along the violation of  health mandates. You dont know who or what I had to go through to get there right in time and then dismiss me and judge me. God bless.

originalText.text:
Can never get ahold of them by phone and I told them when I would be out of my medication and they still got it to me late making me miss a dose.

Edit: took me 3 days but I managed to get ahold of them on the phone since they said I had to call to resolve any insurance issues, got ahold of them Monday was told it would be ready Thursday, went Thursday and was told if I wanted it I had to pay $60 because they hadn't sorted out the insurance. Asked for a manager since yet again, I was going to miss a dose, and was told he was too busy so I should call. Had to get my doctor to call, was told by them it would be ready later, yet again not ready. Sent it to another pharmacy and picked it up an hour later. This CVS has made me miss several doses and refuses to cancel/transfer prescriptions so that you're forced to stay.

originalText.text: This pharmacy always has a long line and the staff is consistently flustered and unfriendly because they are overworked/understaffed. Additionally, they are consistently out of one my husband’s (very-commonly perscribed) medications, which causes us to have to come back often. Also, the main reason we switched to CVS for our maintenance meds is because we are supposed to get a discount for 90-day prescriptions, but I no longer think its worth the ~$5 we save, quarterly, per perscription.
